ЁЯПБ
Last King of the Rai Dynasty

The last Buddhist king of Sindh. He had no sons.

ЁЯОн
Rise of Chach

He appointed a Kashmiri Brahmin named 'Chach' as his minister. Chach conspired with Queen 'Sohan Devi'.

ЁЯУМ
Important Facts (Exam Points)
  • End: After the death of Rai Sahasi, Chach seized the throne and established the Brahman Dynasty of Sindh.
  • Hiuen Tsang: Visited Sindh in 641 CE and described the king as 'Shudra' (possibly due to Buddhist influence).
